intro: Hibbertia wagapii, commonly known as the Warrigal bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with prominent central stamens. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in the eastern regions of Australia, including Queensland and New South Wales. Hibbertia wagapii is a shrub that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It plays an important role in local ecosystems and is often used in native landscaping due to its ornamental value.
